title: General Mills, Audi, Pfizer Join Companies Pausing Twitter Ads
description: Advertisers are concerned about a flurry of executive departures at Twitter and new owner Elon Musk’s plans for content moderation.

title: Robots? Some Companies Find Only Humans Can Do the Job
description: In retail, fast food and delivery, robots with names like Roxo, Rita and Scout have delivered mixed, sometimes quirky results, at costs some companies find too high. In the best of cases, the robots are taking the strain off their human co-workers.

title: Qualcomm's Longer Life With Apple Comes at a Cost
description: The chip maker will keep Apple’s iPhone business a while longer, but a smartphone slowdown hurts its near-term outlook and complicates its diversification plan.

title: Meta's Nick Clegg to New Twitter Owner Elon Musk: 'Welcome to the Club'
description: The president of global affairs at Meta Platforms argues that the Facebook parent’s recent business struggles are overblown.

title: Saudi Arabia to Build Electric Vehicles With Apple Supplier Foxconn
description: The kingdom’s Public Investment Fund is partnering with the biggest assembler of Apple Inc. iPhones.

title: Amazon to Pause Corporate Hiring
description: The e-commerce company said it expects to keep the freeze in place for the next few months.

title: Stripe to Cut 14% of Jobs
description: One of the world’s most highly-valued startups, payment processor Stripe said it is laying off about 14% of its employees and blamed the harsh economic climate.

title: Lyft Plans to Lay Off Hundreds of Employees
description: The ride-hailing company is cutting 13% of staff, or nearly 700 jobs, the latest technology company to say it needed to reduce costs ahead of choppy economic conditions.

title: Paul Allen's Quest for Sunken Warships
description: The late Microsoft co-founder made it his mission to locate some of World War II’s most famous wrecks, using cutting-edge technology.

title: Vonage Will Pay $100 Million to Settle FTC Allegations of Trapping Consumers in Subscriptions
description: Agreement with Ericsson subsidiary represents largest penalty in FTC enforcement push to stop companies from creating obstacles to consumer cancellations,

title: The New Voice Controls Coming to Your Driver's Seat
description: Auto makers are moving toward verbal commands that go deeper into the car’s controls. The car is getting more talkative, too—it could even judge your singing voice.

title: Supply-Chain Tech Provider Project44 Delays Potential Public Offering
description: Supply-chain technology provider project44 has postponed plans for a possible IPO amid the uncertainty in markets, and instead is turning to more venture-capital investment to expand its business tracking goods through global transportation networks.

title: Europe Seeks Exemption From U.S. Rules on EV Tax Breaks
description: A new task force focused on clean-energy tax credits meets this week to address EU concerns that many European-made products won’t qualify for for the U.S. credits because of where they were made.

title: Startups, Investors Bet on Remote Work Future
description: Even as more employers signal an end to remote work, tech startups and their investors are betting that it’s here to stay, offering a range of digital tools designed to support a permanent workforce outside of the office.

title: The Company That Lost $800 Billion
description: Intelligent failures in business are based on small bets. Meta bet the farm.

title: Elon Musk's Proposed Twitter Changes Revive Debate on How to Quash Spam
description: Subscribers would get perks, but doubts arise over whether malicious accounts could be prevented.
